summary: The SHADE Act (H.R. 4212) directs the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to establish a grant program to fund the planting of qualifying trees in eligible areas, specifically redlined areas and areas with an intra-urban heat island effect. Grants will be awarded to eligible entities like state agencies, local governments, and nonprofits. These grants can be used for planning, purchasing trees, planting, maintenance, and training. The bill authorizes appropriations of $50 million per year from 2026 to 2036. The program aims to improve environmental conditions and community well-being in designated areas.
